Class Participant

java.lang.Object
com.education.ztu.game.Participant
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Comparable<Participant>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Employee, Schoolar, Student
public abstract class Participant extends Object implements Cloneable, Comparable<Participant>, Serializable
Abstract base class representing a participant in the game system.

This class serves as the foundation for all participant types in the game, implementing essential interfaces for cloning, comparison, and serialization. All participant types (Schoolar, Student, Employee) must extend this class.

Key Features:

  • Serializable: Participants can be serialized to files for persistence
  • Cloneable: Deep copy support for creating participant duplicates
  • Comparable: Participants can be sorted alphabetically by name
  • Logging: Full SLF4J logging support for debugging

Field Details:

  • name: Participant's full name
  • age: Participant's age (must be non-negative)
  • tempInfo: Transient field that holds temporary data (not serialized)

Usage Example:

// Note: Cannot instantiate abstract class directly
Student student = new Student("John Doe", 20);
String name = student.getName();
int age = student.getAge();
student.setAge(21);

// Cloning
Student clone = (Student) student.clone();

// Comparison
int comparison = student.compareTo(new Student("Jane", 19));
Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Participant

      public Participant(String name, int age)
      Constructs a new Participant with the specified name and age.

      This constructor initializes all fields and sets up temporary information. The tempInfo field is automatically populated with a descriptive message.

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the participant (cannot be null)
      age - the age of the participant (should be non-negative)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if name is null
      See Also:
      • tempInfo

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the participant.

      This method updates the participant's name and logs the change.

      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the participant (should not be null)
      See Also:
      • getName()

    • setAge

      public void setAge(int age)
      Sets the age of the participant.

      This method validates that the age is non-negative before setting it. If a negative age is provided, an exception is thrown and logged.

      Parameters:
      age - the new age for the participant in years
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if age is negative (less than 0)
      See Also:
      • getAge()

    • getTempInfo

      public String getTempInfo()
      Returns the temporary information about the participant.

      Important Note: This field is marked as transient and will be null after deserialization. This is by design - temporary data is not meant to be persisted.

      Returns:
      the temporary information string, or null if not set or after deserialization
      See Also:
      • setTempInfo(String)

    • setTempInfo

      public void setTempInfo(String tempInfo)
      Sets the temporary information for the participant.

      Note that this field is transient and will not be serialized. This is useful for storing runtime-only information.

      Parameters:
      tempInfo - the temporary information to set (can be null)
      See Also:
      • getTempInfo()

    • clone

      public Participant clone()
      Creates and returns a deep copy (clone) of this participant.

      This method uses the Object clone mechanism to create a shallow copy of the participant. Since String and int are immutable, this effectively creates a deep copy.

      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a clone of this participant with identical field values
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if cloning is not supported by the subclass
      See Also:
      • Object.clone()

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

      Two participants are considered equal if and only if:

      • They are the same object in memory, OR
      • They are both Participant instances with identical name AND age
      Note: The tempInfo field is NOT considered in equality comparison.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the reference object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is equal to the argument; false otherwise
      See Also:
      • hashCode()

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for the participant.

      The hash code is calculated based on the name and age fields. Participants with equal name and age will have the same hash code.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this participant
      See Also:
      • equals(Object)
      • Objects.hash(Object...)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the participant.

      The string includes the participant's name, age, and temporary info. Format: Participant{name='...', age=..., tempInfo='...'}

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation containing participant's data

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Participant other)
      Compares this participant with the specified participant for order.

      Participants are ordered alphabetically by their names using natural String comparison. This allows participants to be sorted in lexicographic order.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Participant>
      Parameters:
      other - the participant to be compared (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a negative integer if this participant's name is less than the other's; zero if the names are equal; a positive integer if this participant's name is greater than the other's
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the other participant is null
      See Also:
      • String.compareTo(String)
